name: Buffalo Zoo
description: One of the oldest zoos in the US, home to over 1,200 animals on 23.5 acres. Great for families and wildlife lovers.

name: Buffalo AKG Art Museum
cost: Adults $15-20, discounts for youth and seniors
description: World-class modern & contemporary art museum, reopened after a major renovation in 2023, with engaging exhibitions and a café.

name: Buffalo and Erie County Naval & Military Park
description: Largest inland naval park in the U.S. Visit decommissioned ships and a submarine right on the waterfront.

name: Buffalo & Erie County Botanical Gardens
description: Victorian-style glass conservatory featuring tropical plants, themed gardens, and seasonal events.

name: Martin House Complex
description: Stunning Frank Lloyd Wright-designed home and gardens—tour the architecture and learn about its history.

name: Canalside
description: Vibrant waterfront district with walking paths, concerts, kayak rentals, festivals, and food vendors.

name: Buffalo City Hall Observation Deck
description: Head to the 32-story Art Deco observation deck for panoramic views of Buffalo, Lake Erie, and even Niagara Falls on clear days.

name: Burchfield Penney Art Center
description: Home to the world's largest collection of artist Charles Burchfield, with changing exhibits and outdoor art installations.

name: Buffalo Harbor State Park
cost: Vehicle entry fee ~$10 or NYS parks pass
description: A 190-acre state park & marina on Lake Erie featuring beach access, trails, fishing, and scenic views.

name: Parkside Candy & Ice Cream Shop
description: Historic candy parlor founded in 1919, famous for handmade sponge candy and classic ice cream in a nostalgic setting.
